statements: SELECT * FROM role_based_access_control;
SELECT role_name, permissions FROM role_based_access_control WHERE role_id = 1;
SELECT role_name FROM role_based_access_control WHERE role_id > 2;
SELECT * FROM role_based_access_control WHERE permissions CONTAINS 'write';
SELECT role_id, role_name, permissions FROM role_based_access_control ORDER BY role_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM role_based_access_control ORDER BY role_id DESC;
SELECT role_name, permissions FROM role_based_access_control WHERE role_id = 3;
SELECT role_id, role_name, permissions FROM role_based_access_control WHERE role_name LIKE 'Admin%';
SELECT * FROM role_based_access_control WHERE role_id IN (1, 2, 3) AND ARRAY_CONTAINS(permissions, 'write');
SELECT role_id, COUNT(*) AS num_roles FROM role_based_access_control GROUP BY role_id HAVING num_roles > 1 ORDER BY role_id ASC;
SELECT id, username, role FROM users;
SELECT username, role, id FROM users;
SELECT role, username, id FROM users WHERE id < 100;
SELECT role, username FROM users WHERE role = 'admin' ORDER BY username ASC;
SELECT * FROM users JOIN roles ON users.role = roles.role_name;
SELECT id, username, role FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE id > 100 ORDER BY username DESC;
SELECT * FROM users JOIN roles ON users.role = roles.role_name WHERE users.id = 5;
SELECT username, COUNT(*) as user_count FROM users GROUP BY role HAVING user_count > 1 ORDER BY user_count DESC;
SELECT * FROM roles WHERE role_name LIKE '%admin%' ORDER BY role_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT id, username, role FROM users WHERE role = 'Admin';
SELECT id, role_name FROM roles WHERE description IS NOT NULL;
SELECT id, sensitive_data, permission_type FROM permission WHERE permission_type = 'Read';
SELECT username, password, role FROM users ORDER BY username DESC;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE id = 5;
SELECT username, password FROM users WHERE role = 'user' ORDER BY username ASC;
SELECT u.username, p.permission_type FROM users u INNER JOIN permission p ON u.role = p.role_id WHERE p.sensitive_data = 'credit card';
SELECT u.username, r.role_name, p.permission_type FROM users u INNER JOIN roles r ON u.role = r.id INNER JOIN permission p ON r.id = p.role_id;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE role='admin';
SELECT role_name FROM roles ORDER BY role_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM permissions WHERE permission_name='write';
SELECT username, role FROM users JOIN roles ON users.role_id = roles.role_id;
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT * FROM roles ORDER BY role_name DESC;

SELECT users.username, permissions.permission_name FROM users JOIN role_permissions ON users.role = role_permissions.role_id JOIN permissions ON role_permissions.permission_id = permissions.permission_id;
SELECT role_name FROM roles WHERE role_name LIKE 'm%';
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_users FROM users;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT id, username, role FROM users ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT u.username, r.role_name FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.id = ur.user_id JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.id;

SELECT u.username, p.permission_name FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.id = ur.user_id JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.id JOIN role_permissions rp ON r.id = rp.role_id JOIN permissions p ON rp.permission_id = p.id;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE role='admin';
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE id=1;
SELECT u.username, r.role_name FROM users u INNER JOIN roles r ON u.role=r.id;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE username LIKE '%john%';
SELECT u.*, p.permission_name FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.id=ur.user_id JOIN role_permissions rp ON ur.role_id=rp.role_id JOIN permissions p ON rp.permission_id=p.id;
